Title:
Multiclavula petricola sp. nov. (Cantharellales,
Basidiomycota), a new clavarioid and lichenized fungus growing on
rocks
Abstract:
A clavarioid fungus belonging to Multiclavula was found on
rocks in Gunma prefecture, Japan. Multiclavula petricola is described as
a new species based on morphological characters, its unique habitat, and
molecular phylogenetic analysis of the ITS rDNA sequence. The fruiting
bodies of M. petricola were dispersed on wet rock surface with a lot of
tiny globular lichenized thalli. The phylogenetic analyses indicated
that its affiliation is in the genus Multiclavula, however, the
relationship with other Multiclavula species was not resolved. The
basidiospores of M. petricola germinated on water agar plate, and the
growth on PDA was slow. The brief descriptions of cultural aspects were
also provided.
